1.text: Soak the dried mushrooms for 30 minutes, then drain and slice them.

2.text: Cut the beef into 2 in (5.1 cm) long strips if you’re using it.

3.text: Dice and slice the onion, scallions, garlic, carrot, and zucchini.

4.text: Blanch, rinse, and marinate 2 cups (60 grams) of spinach.

5.text: Cook 6 oz (170 grams) of noodles in boiling water until they’re al dente.

6.text: Drain and rinse the noodles before setting them to the side.

7.text: Stir-fry the sliced beef for 2-3 minutes until it’s fully cooked.

8.text: Cook the vegetables in sesame oil over medium heat.

9.text: Add the spinach, noodles, soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, and protein to the skillet.

10.text: Stir-fry the dish for an additional 2 minutes before removing it from the heat.

11.text: Add salt if the dish needs it, and top it with 1 tbsp (9 grams) of sesame seeds.

12.text: Break 2 eggs and separate the whites from the yolks.

13.text: Sieve the eggs whites and then the yolks through a fine-mesh strainer.

14.text: Whisk the contents of each bowl until the eggs look smooth.

15.text: Oil a non-stick skillet and turn the heat to medium-low.

16.text: Pour the beaten yolk into the skillet cook it for 1 minute.

17.text: Flip the egg yolk and cook it for about 30 more seconds.

18.text: Wipe down the skillet and repeat the process with the egg whites.

19.text: Slice the cooled egg whites and yolks into thin strips and set to the side.
